Question_1.Context: The study focused on the development of a method to screen and confirm sulfonamides in livestock samples.
Question_1.Question: What is the common structure of sulfonamides mentioned in the text?
Question_1.A: Substituted amine on the benzene ring and a sulfonamide group parallel to the amine
Question_1.B: Substituted amine on the benzene ring and a sulfonamide group perpendicular to the amine
Question_1.C: Substituted amine on the benzene ring and a sulfonamide group perpendicular to the ring
Question_1.D: Substituted amine on the benzene ring and a sulfonamide group parallel to the ring
Question_1.Source: They have a common structure of an unsubstituted amine on the benzene ring and a sulfonamide group parallel to the amine.

Question_2.Context: The study validated the performance of the method according to Codex guidelines.
Question_2.Question: What was used to evaluate the linearity of the method?
Question_2.C: Regression line and coefficient of determination
Question_2.Source: The linearity of the method was evaluated by calculating the regression line and expressed as the coefficient of correlation (r2).

Question_3.Context: The study aimed to determine the applicability of the screening method using real livestock samples.
Question_3.Question: What was the average range of recoveries (%) for three laboratories?
Question_3.Source: The validated results indicated positive recoveries of sulfonamides ranging from 70 to 110% for all matrices.

Question_4.Context: The study discussed the matrix effects observed in livestock product samples.
Question_4.Question: What was the range of matrix effects (%) observed in the six livestock products?
Question_4.Source: The overall ME (%) was observed in a range of -71 to 69% in six livestock products.

Question_5.Context: The study applied the developed method to real samples from different regions in South Korea.
Question_5.Question: How many livestock product samples were analyzed in the study?
Question_5.Source: The developed method was applied for the determination of sulfonamides in 129 livestock product samples.

Question_6.Context: The study mentioned the use of a modified QuEChERS method for sample preparation.
Question_6.Question: What was added to the extraction solvent to efficiently target the analytes?
Question_6.Source: The addition of acetic acid to ACN was examined to efficiently target the analytes.

Question_7.Context: The study discussed the validation of the method according to Codex guidelines.
Question_7.Question: What was used to evaluate the accuracy of the method?
Question_7.Source: The recovery was used to evaluate the accuracy of the method.

Question_8.Context: The study evaluated the precision of the method by calculating the coefficient of variation.
Question_8.Question: What was the maximum acceptable coefficient of variation (%) for the method?
Question_8.Source: The CV range of all sulfonamides was below 15%, indicating the favorable repeatability of the recovery test.

Question_9.Context: The study applied the method to determine sulfonamides in livestock product samples.
Question_9.Question: How many compounds showed moderate signal enhancement in beef samples?
Question_9.Source: In beef, 7 compounds (23%) were observed for moderate signal enhancement.

Question_10.Context: The study discussed the application of the method to real samples from South Korea.
Question_10.Question: How many compounds showed high signal suppression in pork fat samples?
